Please enter a search term. 8 News Now, the most trusted source for Las Vegas news, works closely with trusted Nexstar news partners across the West to monitor what’s happening in surrounding communities. Our regional partnerships enhance the impact of our journalism, as we strive to curate uniquely relevant experiences for our local readers in North Las Vegas, Henderson, Boulder City Pahrump, and Mesquite, and beyond. Stay on top of what’s happening near your family and friends by visiting our news partners in California, Hawaii, Oregon, Nevada, Montana, Utah, and Colorado. The Bay Area’s local news leader KRON4.com has the latest San Francisco breaking news, weather, sports, and events coverage. For the latest up-to-the-minute updates, KRONon is streaming live 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Don’t miss a story, sign up for the KRON4 newsletter to get the top Bay Area news stories and breaking news updates delivered straight to your inbox. FOX40 News in Sacramento is committed to “News That Matters,” sharing stories and creating content that informs and empowers people throughout the Sacramento-Stockton-Modesto region. You can always expect the latest local news, sports and weather coverage across multiple platforms. Sign up for the FOX40 newsletter to get “News That Matters” directly to your inbox. Download the FOX40 mobile app to stay up-to-date anywhere, anytime. KGET 17 News is the local leader for Bakersfield news, weather, and sports. KGET.com is your go-to source for everything from true crime to the latest in local politics. Sign up for the KGET newsletter to get your daily rundown of all things Kern County. YourCentralValley.com is the premier Fresno news provider. Serving California’s central valley, Fresno’s first TV station is the home to both KSEE24, the local NBC affiliate, and CBS47, the local CBS affiliate. The platform brings the most up-to-date local news and weather to over two million people across Fresno, Tulare, Merced, Madera, Kings, and Mariposa counties. The first commercial TV station licensed west of the Mississippi, Los Angeles-based KTLA has been keeping Southern Californians informed since 1947. Join us on Channel 5, ktla.com, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. FOX 5 News in San Diego is the local FOX affiliate TV station proudly serving America’s Finest City and the local military community with award-winning news, entertainment, sports, and original content across multiple platforms. FOX 5 produces 12 hours of local news each weekday, the most in the market. Sign up to get San Diego breaking news and other headlines in your inbox. KHON2 news is the news team that is working for Hawaii – covering breaking news, weather, and sports on all the islands. Sign up for the free KHON2 newsletter to get the stories you care about delivered straight to your inbox. KOIN 6, the Portland news leader, brings you the latest breaking news, weather, and sports for the Portland and Vancouver metro area. KOIN.com is your go-to source for the latest stories that make Oregon and Southwest Washington a better place to live. Subscribe to the KOIN 6 News daily newsletter for stories delivered to your inbox and download the KOIN 6 News app for the latest headlines to your phone. ABC4 Utah in Salt Lake City covers breaking news, weather, and sports for the entire state of Utah, including portions of Nevada, Idaho, and Wyoming. Also known as KTVX, ABC4 is home to the most accurate Utah weather forecasts 10 years in a row, “Good Things Utah”, the leading Utah lifestyle show, and sports coverage of the Utah Jazz. Sign up for the free ABC4 Utah newsletter to get the stories you care about delivered straight to your inbox. FOX31 KDVR and Colorado’s Very Own Channel 2 KWGN are your source for Denver news, Colorado weather, and local sports in Denver and throughout Colorado’s Front Range and Rocky Mountains. We bring you Problem Solvers investigations; news stories dedicated to military members, veterans, and their families through Serving Those Who Serve; and we cover the Denver Broncos on the Orange & Blue Report. We’re on top of the latest breaking news 24/7, streaming live Denver newscasts, sending email newsletters, and brining you a complete list of Denver area school closings on KDVR.com and the FOX31 & Channel 2 App. FOX21 is the Colorado Springs and Pikes Peak region’s trusted news source. Providing expert weather reporting and forecasting, community-driven news coverage, breaking news, and a wide-range of sporting events – from your closest high school to the Denver Broncos. FOX21 puts people first and covers the topics they care about. KREX is home to the latest Grand Junction news, weather, and sports. From football and rodeos, to the ski slopes and great outdoors, sun or snow. Telling your stories from Grand Junction and Montrose to Aspen, Telluride, Crested Butte, Gunnison, and Glenwood Springs since 1954. We’re Western Colorado’s longest-running TV news source. Sign up for the free KREX WesternSlopeNow newsletter to get the stories you care about delivered straight to your inbox. KSVI and KHMT in Billings, Montana covers the biggest news and events for everything under the Big Sky. YourBigSky.com is the premier online platform for Central Montana and Northern Wyoming, and a local business search engine with maps, events, classifieds, news, weather, sports, web links, and videos.'}]

Please enter a search term. Heather joined the 8 News Now team in Aug. 2021 and has called the Las Vegas valley her home since 2016. Heather is an Emmy-nominated anchor and reporter; her career has allowed her to cover a wide range of breaking news, human interest, and entertainment stories, including red carpet events. She has also helped drivers navigate their morning rush-hour commute with traffic reports. Heather’s passion for news started as a toddler dancing to the opening music at the start of the nightly news watching her dad on TV. Heather’s father retired in 2020 from the CBS station in Los Angeles, but he has been the inspiration behind her decision to follow in his footsteps. Shortly after graduating from the University of San Diego, Heather launched her journalism career as a writer for the CBS affiliate station in San Diego and kept viewers informed in Wichita Falls, Albuquerque, Denver, and Las Vegas. Heather is an adventurer at heart. You can usually find her hiking in the mountains, paddle-boarding Lake Mead, and traveling Central America, all the while rooting for the Golden Knights and the Dodgers. You can also catch her around the valley with her husband and their rescue dog Napoleon. For all the fun, check out her Instagram @NewsieHeather and make sure you say “hi” if you see her around town.'}]
